comment.author: 22575440@N07
comment._content: wow, amazing photo! how scary those people sitting on the ledges!

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Trying to place the shooting point of the photo it appears to be up around either the GPO or the old Metropole but the GPO would probably still have been a wreck at that time?  Interesting to see the people out on the window ledges, not at all uncommon in years gone by but today with insurance concerns and health and safety issues they would probably be arrested???

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Around the Metropole(-ish)? But was that rebuilt by 1922, and if so, were stone blocks used on the facade?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: Those guys on the ledge are mad to do that !

comment.author: 20727502@N00
comment._content: Looks like the Metropole to me. The lamps (next to the guys on the ledge) seem to match those from this 1950s view. Angle and distance also seem to stack up.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Nice one gulio, the lamps, the stonework and the angle are right as you say!  The canopy is missing but that might have been put up later or perhaps the photographer was standing on it when the photo was taken?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/20727502@N00] Thanks for the link to allhails' amazing photos, and yep, as swordscookie says, it does look as if the Metropole ledge is the location...
